Taylor Arnold

Assistant Professor of Statistics, University of Richmond

Courses Blog Research

Assessment D

For the fourth in-class assessment, you should be familiar with the syntax and ideas behind the following:

  • understand the difference between integers, doubles, characters, dates, and date-times
  • understand the naming conventions for variables in this class
  • know how to properly space around the <- sign
  • know how to construct a full data schema
  • know how to extract a variable from a data frame
  • know how to produce a simple plot of a variable
  • know how to convert a variable to character variable with as.character
  • know how, and understand what is going on, to convert a numeric variable to a character variable with cut

Remember, the assessment includes fill in the blank questions, not just multiple choice, so make sure you remember the specific function commands.
